00070 template <
00071     typename LowerType, typename UpperType,
00072     typename LowerExclType, typename UpperExclType,
00073     typename CompareType
00074 >
00075 class within_bounds :
00076     // The order of parameters of compressed_pairs below may seem a bit odd, but:
00077     // - grouping them like <L, LE>, <U, UE> will cause error when L = U and
00078     //   LE = UE (the same type repeated in base classes list),
00079     // - grouping them like <L, U>, <LE, UE> will prohibit full space optimization
00080     //   when L = U or LE = UE due to the way compressed_pair is implementated.
00081     // Note, that the current solution would also cause repeated base class error
00082     // in the case when L = UE and U = LE, but such case seems to be very unlikely
00083     // and rather erroneous.
00084     private boost::compressed_pair<LowerType, LowerExclType>,
00085     private boost::compressed_pair<UpperExclType, UpperType>,
00086     private CompareType
00087 {
00088 
00089     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( boost::is_convertible<LowerExclType, bool>::value ));
00090     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(( boost::is_convertible<UpperExclType, bool>::value ));
00091 
00092 
00093 // Shorthand typedefs:
00094 
00095     typedef
00096         boost::compressed_pair<LowerType, LowerExclType>
00097         _lower_holder_type;
00098 
00099     typedef
00100         boost::compressed_pair<UpperExclType, UpperType>
00101         _upper_holder_type;
00102 
00103 
00104 public:
00105 
00106 
00107 // Remember the template's actual parameters:
00108 
00110     typedef LowerType lower_type;
00111 
00113     typedef UpperType upper_type;
00114 
00116     typedef LowerExclType lower_excl_type;
00117 
00119     typedef UpperExclType upper_excl_type;
00120 
00122     typedef CompareType compare_type;
00123 
00124 
00125 // Access to the generators and compare object:
00126 
00128     lower_type & lower_bound()
00129     { return _lower_holder_type::first(); }
00130 
00132     const lower_type & lower_bound() const
00133     { return _lower_holder_type::first(); }
00134 
00135 
00137     upper_type & upper_bound()
00138     { return _upper_holder_type::second(); }
00139 
00141     const upper_type & upper_bound() const
00142     { return _upper_holder_type::second(); }
00143 
00144 
00146     lower_excl_type & lower_bound_excluded()
00147     { return _lower_holder_type::second(); }
00148 
00150     const lower_excl_type & lower_bound_excluded() const
00151     { return _lower_holder_type::second(); }
00152 
00153 
00155     upper_excl_type & upper_bound_excluded()
00156     { return _upper_holder_type::first(); }
00157 
00159     const upper_excl_type & upper_bound_excluded() const
00160     { return _upper_holder_type::first(); }
00161 
00162 
00164     compare_type & compare()
00165     { return *this; }
00166 
00168     const compare_type & compare() const
00169     { return *this; }
00170 
00171 
00172 // Special member functions and swap:
00173 
00179     within_bounds() :
00180         _lower_holder_type(lower_type(), lower_excl_type()),
00181         _upper_holder_type(upper_excl_type(), upper_type()),
00182         compare_type()
00183     { }
00184 
00185     // Using implicitly-declared other special member functions.
00186 
00189     void swap(within_bounds & other)
00190     {
00191         _lower_holder_type::swap(other);
00192         _upper_holder_type::swap(other);
00193         boost::swap(compare(), other.compare());
00194     }
00195 
00196 
00197 // Other constructors:
00198 
00204     explicit within_bounds(const compare_type & c) :
00205         _lower_holder_type(lower_type(), lower_excl_type()),
00206         _upper_holder_type(upper_excl_type(), upper_type()),
00207         compare_type(c)
00208     { }
00209 
00216     within_bounds(const lower_type & l, const upper_type & u) :
00217         _lower_holder_type(l, lower_excl_type()),
00218         _upper_holder_type(upper_excl_type(), u),
00219         compare_type()
00220     { }
00221 
00228     within_bounds(const lower_excl_type & le, const upper_excl_type & ue) :
00229         _lower_holder_type(lower_type(), le),
00230         _upper_holder_type(ue, upper_type()),
00231         compare_type()
00232     { }
00233 
00239     within_bounds(const lower_type & l, const upper_type & u, const compare_type & c) :
00240         _lower_holder_type(l, lower_excl_type()),
00241         _upper_holder_type(upper_excl_type(), u),
00242         compare_type(c)
00243     { }
00244 
00250     within_bounds(const lower_excl_type & le, const upper_excl_type & ue, const compare_type & c) :
00251         _lower_holder_type(lower_type(), le),
00252         _upper_holder_type(ue, upper_type()),
00253         compare_type(c)
00254     { }
00255 
00262     within_bounds(const lower_type & l, const upper_type & u,
00263                   const lower_excl_type & le, const upper_excl_type & ue) :
00264         _lower_holder_type(l, le),
00265         _upper_holder_type(ue, u),
00266         compare_type()
00267     { }
00268 
00271     within_bounds(const lower_type & l, const upper_type & u,
00272                   const lower_excl_type & le, const upper_excl_type & ue, const compare_type & c) :
00273         _lower_holder_type(l, le),
00274         _upper_holder_type(ue, u),
00275         compare_type(c)
00276     { }
00277 
00278 
00279 // Functions for checking whether a value lays within the bounds:
00280 
00284     template <typename T>
00285     bool is_below(const T & value) const
00286     {
00287         if( !lower_bound_excluded() )
00288             return compare()(value, lower_bound());
00289         else
00290             return !compare()(lower_bound(), value);
00291     }
00292 
00296     template <typename T>
00297     bool is_above(const T & value) const
00298     {
00299         if( !upper_bound_excluded() )
00300             return compare()(upper_bound(), value);
00301         else
00302             return !compare()(value, upper_bound());
00303     }
00304 
00308     template <typename T>
00309     bool is_within(const T & value) const
00310     {
00311         return !is_below(value) && !is_above(value);
00312     }
00313 
00316     template <typename T>
00317     bool operator () (const T & value) const
00318     {
00319         return is_within(value);
00320     }
00321 
00322 }; // class within_bounds<>

00328 template <typename L, typename U, typename LE, typename UE, typename C>
00329 void swap(within_bounds<L, U, LE, UE, C> & lhs, within_bounds<L, U, LE, UE, C> & rhs)
00330 {
00331     lhs.swap(rhs);
00332 }

00337 template <
00338     typename ValueType,
00339     typename LowerType = ValueType,
00340     typename UpperType = LowerType,
00341     typename ErrorPolicy = throw_exception<>,
00342     typename LowerExclType = boost::mpl::false_,
00343     typename UpperExclType = LowerExclType,
00344     typename CompareType = std::less<ValueType>
00345 >
00346 struct bounded
00347 {
00348 
00350     typedef
00351         constrained<
00352             ValueType,
00353             within_bounds<
00354                 LowerType,
00355                 UpperType,
00356                 LowerExclType,
00357                 UpperExclType,
00358                 CompareType
00359             >,
00360             ErrorPolicy
00361         > type;
00362 
00363 };
00364 
00366 template <
00367     typename ValueType,
00368     ValueType LowerBound,
00369     ValueType UpperBound,
00370     typename ErrorPolicy = throw_exception<>,
00371     bool LowerExcl = false,
00372     bool UpperExcl = LowerExcl,
00373     typename CompareType = std::less<ValueType>
00374 >
00375 struct bounded_int
00376 {
00377 
00379     typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME
00380         bounded<
00381             ValueType,
00382             boost::mpl::integral_c<ValueType, LowerBound>,
00383             boost::mpl::integral_c<ValueType, UpperBound>,
00384             ErrorPolicy,
00385             boost::mpl::bool_<LowerExcl>,
00386             boost::mpl::bool_<UpperExcl>,
00387             CompareType
00388         >::type type;
00389 
00390 };

00410 template <typename V, typename L, typename U, typename LE, typename UE, typename C, typename E,
00411     typename TL, typename TU, typename TLE, typename TUE>
00412 void change_bounds(constrained<V, within_bounds<L, U, LE, UE, C>, E> & b,
00413     const TL & l, const TU & u, const TLE & le, const TUE & ue)
00414 {
00415     change_constraint(b, within_bounds<L, U, LE, UE, C>(l, u, le, ue, b.constraint().compare()));
00416 }
00417 
00432 template <typename V, typename L, typename U, typename LE, typename UE, typename C, typename E,
00433     typename TL, typename TU>
00434 void change_bounds(constrained<V, within_bounds<L, U, LE, UE, C>, E> & b,
00435     const TL & l, const TU & u)
00436 {
00437     change_bounds(b, l, u, b.constraint().lower_bound_excluded(), b.constraint().upper_bound_excluded());
00438 }

00454 template <typename V, typename L, typename U, typename LE, typename UE, typename C, typename E,
00455     typename TLE, typename TUE>
00456 void change_bounds_exclusion(constrained<V, within_bounds<L, U, LE, UE, C>, E> & b,
00457     const TLE & le, const TUE & ue)
00458 {
00459     change_bounds(b, b.constraint().lower_bound(), b.constraint().upper_bound(), le, ue);
